page.title: 03Bridgnorth Police Force
page.content: Bridgnorth Police Force is made up of Bridgnorth Town and Bridgnorth Section which patrols Morville, Worfield, Alveley, Highley and Cleobury Mortimer and is under the charge of a Chief Inspector and comprises thirty policemen and two policewomen. The worst crime that the police have dealt with in the Bridgnorth Area this century was a murder. The most common crimes committed are theft and assault. The average number of accidents dealt with by the Police in Bridgnorth is 1.5 each day. There was a considerable increase in crime in 1983, but in 1984 the figures have dropped. 12 Police Officers from Bridgnorth were involved in Picketing Duties at Coal Mines during the strikes in l984-85. The present Police Station opened in new premises in 1972.
